title: VibeCAD: CAD Skills Library for Coding Agents
description:
A library of Claude Code skills for teaching coding agents how to use various CAD tools.

## Completed
- [x] build123d skill with zero-setup uv/uvx
- [x] 15 curated examples
- [x] Geometry inspection harness
- [x] Marketplace/plugin structure

## Planned CAD Tools
- [ ] OpenSCAD - Programmatic CSG modeling
- [ ] CadQuery - Python CAD with fluent API
- [ ] FreeCAD - Full-featured open source CAD
- [ ] Blender Python API - 3D modeling/animation
- [ ] trimesh - Mesh processing library

## Goals
- Zero-setup instructions (uv/uvx where possible)
- Comprehensive examples for each tool
- Clear documentation of common patterns
- Cross-tool comparisons where helpful

title: Add gggears parametric gear library support
description: Integrate gggears (https://github.com/GarryBGoode/gggears) into the build123d skill. gggears provides advanced parametric gear generation including spur gears, helical gears, bevel gears, ring gears, cycloid gears, and racks.

title: Create error-to-example index in quick-reference.md
description:
## Context

Related to semantic tagging (VibeCAD-o2b). Agents need a quick lookup from error messages to relevant examples.

## Proposal

Add a section to quick-reference.md:

\`\`\`markdown
## Error Message Index

| Error Message | Likely Cause | See Example |
|--------------|--------------|-------------|
| "radius too large" | Fillet on thin edge | 28_fillet_workarounds.py |
| "wire not closed" | Gap in sketch | 24_intersection_corners.py |
| "cannot offset" | Self-intersecting offset | 22_plane_offsets.py |
| "boolean failed" | Non-manifold geometry | 21_split_and_mirror.py |
\`\`\`

## Benefits

- Single searchable table for common errors
- Agents can grep for exact error text
- Links directly to relevant example

## Depends on

- VibeCAD-o2b (semantic tagging) should define the error categories first

title: Add fillet workaround skill example (example 28)
description:
## Context

TTT coaching experiments revealed that large fillets (R4, R10, R5) consistently fail with "radius too large" errors on thin geometry. The current build123d skill (examples 21-27) doesn't document workaround patterns.

## Problem

When agents encounter fillet failures, they don't know the workaround pattern:
1. Create oversized geometry before filleting
2. Apply fillet to the larger feature
3. Trim back to final dimensions

## Requested Example

Add `28_fillet_workarounds.py` covering:
- Detecting when fillets will fail (radius vs edge length)
- Pre-filleting geometry expansion technique
- Alternative: chamfer + loft for large radius transitions
- Edge selection patterns for complex fillet groups

## Evidence

From ppp0104 (Angle Bracket) evaluation:
- Final IoU: 64.2% (failed, needed 95%)
- Blocker: R4, R10, R5 fillets all failed
- Student tried 5 rounds but couldn't discover workaround pattern

title: Add semantic trigger tags to skill examples
description:
## Context

TTT coaching experiments showed that agents load skills but struggle to find relevant sections when encountering specific errors. The skill has good content but poor discoverability.

## Problem

When an agent sees "radius too large" error, they need to know to search for "fillet workaround" - but that semantic connection isn't documented.

## Proposal

Add trigger tags to each skill example in comments:

\`\`\`python
# Example 28: Fillet Workarounds
# TRIGGERS: "radius too large", "fillet failed", "cannot fillet edge"  
# USE WHEN: Large fillets fail on thin geometry
# SYMPTOMS: OCC error, topology error during fillet
\`\`\`

## Benefits

1. Agents can search skill for error messages they encounter
2. "USE WHEN" describes the problem, not just the solution
3. "SYMPTOMS" maps OCC/build123d errors to relevant examples

## Scope

- Add tags to existing examples 21-27
- Define tag format standard
- Add tags to new examples (28+) as they're created
- Consider adding to quick-reference.md as searchable index
